intro: Epacris lasiantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved epacris, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the Heath family (Ericaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and dense clusters of tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open forests and heathlands. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, are pollinated by birds and insects. Epacris lasiantha is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and blooms.
